Label: Trend
Description: The general direction in which something is developing or changing

Label: Sample Size
Description: The size of the same used to produce thew statistic in question

Label: Hours per Week
Description: Refers to a range of hours such as hours of care provided per week

Label: Employment Status
Description: Employment status of people being measure such as Employed or self-employed

Label: Employment Type
Description: A sub category of Employment status that defines the employment type such as full-time or part-time etc.

Label: Adult Carers
Description: Used to define if the statistic involves just Carers or all Adults

Label: Source of Income
Description: Main source of income of people being measured such as Wages and Salaries Investments or Tax credits etc.

Label: Net Weekly Income
Description: Range of net weekly income in Â£s for people the being measured

Label: Person cared for Type
Description: Refers to who a Carer is caring for such as in their own household or not or if they care for more than one person

Label: Person cared for
Description: A sub category of Person cared for type which defines who the person being cared for is such as Parent Spouse Brother or relative etc.

Label: Frequency of care
Description: Refers the number of times a person receives care in number of times a day or week

Label: People
Description: Refers to if the people being measure are receiving care or not

Label: Percentage of People
Description: The percentage of all people measured who meet the criteria

Label: Marker
Description: Defines the reason for any missing values

Label: Identified support needs of homeless households
